summary: Jenny Law and the RPD Drag Race Squad, Part Deux
description:
Back on Feb 17th, I filed an issue ( http://seeclickfix.com/issues/926038 ) and it was politely closed and swept under the rug by one Capt RL Munn RPD as being a necessity to insure public safety.

With all due respect, I call BS. 

Here it is almost 2am on a work night, and there's a party going on in front of my house! With cops! In cars! Flying up and down the road. Screeching tires! Flashing lights! Whooping and hollering (ok, maybe not so much whooping and hollering but my point is)

ITS. TWO. AM. ON. A. WORK. NIGHT. PEOPLE!!! I cant sleep. I mean, I *could* sleep but.... I go to sleep and the Indy 500 starts in my front yard. As I pointed out to the very nice female officer whom I approached whilst seated beside Six Forks Rd, ITS TWO AM ON A WORK NIGHT, can't you move your operation 100 yards up the road to the corner of Cranbrook? There's a wider spot in the road! You can get people on radar quicker! You can see further up the road! There are no houses near there were you are going to ADVERSELY AFFECT SOMEONES SLEEP!! Her curt and polite answer was "Oh, well we like this spot, it's our favorite, we've always used it" Really? I mean, hold on. REALLY?
You wanna catch speeders you say, Capt RL Munn? Well then why don't you get your race team out here each and every morning from 7am to, oh, 9am and run a Florida Speed Trap with an officer on the side of the road running radar and 10 cars behind him, primed and ready to pounce. Lets never mind the fact that it'll snarl traffic so severely someone might actually complain, but you say basically I will be woken (or is that awoke?) each and every night your officers so dictate that they park in their "favorite spot" because you know, its for the 'greater good'. If the 'greater good' is getting speeders to slow down as the are approaching Carroll Middle School (as a member of the Capital Police pointed out to me) then shouldn't your teams be out en force at an later hour instead of 2am?

My eyes are burning. I haven't any sleep, and I have to be up and out the door in T-minus 5 hrs to go to work.  Thank you Raleigh Police Department, it's highly appreciated. Good night. Or good morning or what the heck ever.
address: 5140-5148 Six Forks Road Raleigh, North Carolina

description:
PLEASE re-open my earlier concern about the bus stop in front of the east facade of 401 Oberlin Road.  This morning, coach 1284, Outbound 12 Method, leaving Moore Square Station *DID* board passengers at the shelter located as described above.  *HOWEVER*, I could not see that there was any sign indicating that this was a CAT bus stop.  AND, MOREOVER, the safety concern I alluded to in my earlier inquiry has not been alleviated.  Specifically, the stop located about 8-9 meters North of the intersection of Oberlin and Stafford has not been moved to the site east of 401 Oberlin with passenger amenities.  The stop at 401 Oberlin Road appears to be without sign, which will discourage new riders from choosing this as an initial point of engagement with the CAT system and -- arguably -- causes confusion to existing riders as to whether passenger amenities are available to all patrons or -- at certain locales -- only to an exclusive group of invitees.  

The exiting stop, 8-9 meters north of the intersection of Oberlin and Stafford is a pedestrian death waiting to happen.

I sincerely invite you to ask the driver of coach 1284, Outbound 12 Method about the measures she TRIED to take to warn a passenger who had just disembarked that a vehicle was turning west onto Stafford from the Southbound center lane of Oberlin in front of the coach and wholly without regard to pedestrian traffic crossing Stafford.

This is NOT an irregular occurrence and – in fact – will become less infrequent as the 401 building becomes more completely occupied.

I appreciate that the current stop on Oberlin is convenient for workers and patrons (including many seniors) wishing to visit the McDonald's on Oberlin Road and Cameron, but – on balance – I think the physical welfare and even lives of the few folks who disembark and trod south on the Oberlin sidewalk trumps the imposition of a few extra steps to reach the workplace or free coffee.

I'm always very careful due to this, but it keeps happening and its sad. It just happened to me again and a driver's behavior following the conflict really upset me (cutting around me and slamming on breaks), but thankfully didn't result in an accident. Would it be possible to put up a sign/warning- on Sugar Bush to remind drivers to yield to U-turning vehicles on Creedmoor? Open to other suggestions. summary: Crosswalks and Sidewalks to Keep Students Safe
description: The intersection of Dixie Forest Rd., Litchford Rd., Old Wake Forest Rd., and Atlantic Ave is perpetually busy with multiple lanes of 45 mph traffic. At this intersection is the new and hugely popular Sheetz gas station, Han-Dee Hugo's convenience store, and a soon-to-open Waffle House. The intersection is less than 100 yards from Millbrook High School. Several affordable apartment communities are also within walking distance of this popular intersection. On a daily basis, I see pedestrians of all ages hazardously crossing from one corner to another to access the aforementioned places. Most prominently, I see adolescents crossing these intersections coming from the direction of MHS and River Birch apartments. Many of these pedestrians belong to minority racial groups. There are no crosswalks at these intersections. A few years ago, a high school student was hit by a car while trying to cross this intersection. As business continues to develop and students, workers, and community members continue to use these pathways, it is imperative that they are provided with crosswalks and sidewalks to safely cross streets.
address: 2321-2399 Dixie Forest Road Raleigh, North Carolina

summary: Excessive number of speed bumps -Alleghany Drive

The city decides to add speed bumps in Country Club Hills on Alleghany Drive.But did you know they are planning to put in SEVEN SPEED Bumps? Seven bumps on a very very short distance! Umm I'm thinking this is excessive and now very unsafe for Emergency vehicles coming down Alleghany. 
Alleghany Drive has had ONE car accident which happened in 1973! But they have had many many emergency vehicles that have needed to come to that street. With many property owners being seniors, this is an issue!
Turning in and out of the 3332 Alleghany Drive house will literally have to do so on the hump. It is that close to the driveway! Ridiculous! 
Please remove some of these bumps!  The city has over-killed their intentions!

description:
A small portion of Lorimer Rd was closed last Thurs. (not in front of any houses) so the recycling truck completely skipped the section between Onslow Rd and Garland Dr.  By Monday night, still no pickup, so I submitted a pickup request online.

Problem 1: The online form does not have a space for adding free text or noting that more houses besides my own were not serviced.
Problem 2: A truck came this morning and got my recycle, but did not get the neighbors!  So the driver came out there just to get mine, and did not have the sense to think that maybe all the other blue containers along the street also need emptying.
Problem 3: The driver who emptied my container left it out in the street.  He could have taken three more steps and gotten it out of the street, but instead he left a safety hazard.

Not impressed.

summary: No safe way for cars/pedestrains to proceed through the intersection
description: The convergence of Poplar St, Mordecai Dr and Courtland Dr causes a 5 point intersection. Drivers coming north on Mordecai Dr appear to have the "right of way", but they cannot safely see around the corner to turn left onto Courtland Dr., as they cannot see oncoming traffic yet are forced to yield on the left turn.  Traffic on Poplar St cannot see well enough around the corner, yet they have to yield to traffic coming north on Mordecai Dr.  Pedestrians added into the mix (without any crosswalks) are also unable to see traffic coming from various directions.  Make this a 5 way stop before somebody gets killed, please.

description: There should be a "No left Turn"  from Brookside into Conn Elementary during carpool hours.  Having cars come  from the left and then cars lined up on Brookside trying to make a right into Conn, then all the cars traveling through.  Not too mention all the excited kids running around.  It is a crazy mess.  I think that one small change would help.  Then you would have ALL the cars lined up along Brookside making a right, the cars traveling through, would not have to sit through multiple cycles while a car trying to make the left gets caught in the middle of the street. Kids would have an easier path with the crossing guard instead of having to walk in and out of cars.  Just during carpool time so it would not be a big change for folks all the time.  Ligon has done something similar and that has made things run so much smoother.

summary: Cedar tree blocking pedestrian's view at crossing
description: There's a pedestrian crosswalk in the median between the church at 2723 Clark Ave. and their parking lot.  Immediately to the right (east) of that crosswalk, there's a large cedar tree that blocks pedestrians' view of oncoming traffic.  It's just a matter of time before someone steps out in front of an oncoming car that was blocked by the tree.  The city recently removed a dead crepe myrtle to the left (west) of that crosswalk.  Could the city transplant the beautiful cedar tree from its current location to the former location of the crepe myrtle?  In any case, the cedar tree needs to be removed to prevent a tragedy.

description: Another close call. Drivers are routinely switching lanes inside of the intersection at this dangerous, confusing intersection.   This issue had been submitted earlier.  Lanes do not line up as one moves through the intersection and some drivers mistakenly believe they can choose any of the four lanes south of the intersection regardless of the lane they are in when entering the intersection from the north (Lead Mine Rd).  There are hash marks leading drivers through, but these are ignored. Either because drivers cannot see the faded marks or they do not understand what is going on.  This is causing other drivers to swerve out of the way of these lane changing drivers. Please do something to make this intersection safer by repainting the marks, adding reflectors/bollards and/or additional signage to instruct drivers how to move safely through the intersection.
address: 4350-4398 Lead Mine Road Raleigh, NC 27612, USA

description: Many trucks (dumptrucks and 18-wheelers, mostly) mistakenly turn left off S. Wilmington St. onto Layden St. into Hertford Village. The three straight lanes flow into four lanes after the signal light at North Hills Dr. There are hash lines painted in the intersection indicating the two left straight lanes are to flow directly into the two left turning lanes to go to the beltline or to go east on Glenwood Ave. that leaves the right lane from Lead Mine to go into the either of the two right lanes going straight onto Blue Ridge Rd. or to turn right on Glenwood. 

Those hash marks in the intersection of Lead Mine and North Hills Dr. are so faded, that it is difficult for drivers to know which lane they should remain in when moving through the intersection. There are many close calls between the drivers moving over when they are in the middle straight lane and leave the turning lane to go straight across Glenwood. 

Please repaint the hash marks in the intersection of Lead Mine Rd. and North Hills Dr. or place reflectors so drivers realize they should look right before switching lanes within the intersection.

description: Actually, it isn't overgrowth, it's devastation. This area which is called an overflow for Crabtree creek or as my neighbors now call it, a lake, has been neglected in its drainage issues and as a result the existing trees are dying from the inside. In the picture you can see where trees are snapping.  This beautiful area that is being neglected is losing it's natural beauty and as a result the wildlife (herons, egrets, hawks, owls, woodpeckers) is suffering. Last week a tree snapped and fell on my property (which I cleaned up) shouldn't we work to preserve this area instead of watching it deteriorate as it has over the last 10 years?

description: This property is severly overgrown in the back yard.  I understand that if the city can't see it from the street they can't do anything but you CAN see this from the street.  There are weeds and saplings over the six foot privacy fence.  There is poison ivy growing up the trees and through the fence into neighboring yards.  There are rodents running throught the yard.  There is standing water with mosquitoes breeding.  There are wild animals pushing through the fence into neighboring yards.  This property is decreasing the property values of the homes around or near it.  This property has been reported at least three times that I am aware of.  It was reported last year as well.  The city came out last year and the owner mowed down the weeds and saplings leaving a square in the middle of the yard untouched.  That is not acceptable.  The untouched section was still a breeding ground for voles, mice, snakes and mosquitoes.  The yards around this property are unusable due to the poison ivy growing through, the mosquitoes and the rodents running.  Children are unable to play in the neighboring yards because of the risk of poison and the possiblity of snakes, rodents etc.  Pets are unable to be left in neighboring yards due to the risk of hearworm carrying mosquitoes.

description:
The owners moved out a few months ago and their son is crashing here now but not maintaining the property at all. RPD advised to report to SeeClickFix the conditions to initiate a nuisance case against the property.

This morning RPD and animal control removed an emaciated and abused dog from the property. She was starved for at least two months according to Animal Control. Criminal abuse charges are now pending against the son. The windows were open and the smell of cat feces was in the air. There is still at least one cat inside the sparsely furnished home. 

The grass is knee high and gone to seed. There are large broken limbs littered through the yard.

summary: Need trash cans on Person corridor
description:
Need more trash cans in the Person/Blount/cabarrus area. Lincoln theatre is a big draw to the area and the trash situation along cabarrus toward Person is getting worse. An easy remedy would be installing a few trash cans on this area. 

Moreover, people walk dogs and need a place to discard their business. Without trash cans, people are more likely to not pick up.
This area as of late, has a horid odor that makes sitting at that light unbearable. It smells like something is decomposing.

30 ft below the "Capital Hills Connector" intersection, in the CENTER of the 3 SOUTHBOUND lanes, there is the a large shallow pothole which will, left unattended, become a dangerous pothole.   This is likely because the U-turn traffic typically lands in the this lane.  This is a heavily travelled roadway, and traffic crosses this area doing 55mph or greater, including semi's and other heavy vehicles, when the light allows it - so significant damage to vehicles, or causation of an accident, can ensue.  It would be appropriate for this area to be paved with a more durable surface.

summary: Urgent and 3rd request : ZERO visibility due to a hedge on Wake Forest / Poplar.  Other Issues not noted above
description:
This is an URGENT safety issue.  We need a permanent and immediate solution to the hedge located on a property on Wake Forest road (about 1/2 block up, on the left as you face north) near the intersection of Poplar Street.. This hedge COMPLETELY blocks visibility for cars on Poplar that are trying to turn onto Wake Forest Road in either direction. Many, if not most,  residents of Mordecai, Pilot Mill and Capitol Park use Poplar to get onto Wake Forest Road every day, several times a day and each time, it is a roll of the dice if a car coming down WF toward downtown will hit you.   This is my third time reporting this.  It was addressed once, and the hegde was trimmed back a little but it  quickly grows back.  Please have the entire hedge removed before someone gets very hurt.   We look forward to your prompt reply. 

Original report of the issue: There are large shrubs on the sidewalk that severely block visibility for drivers trying to turn left (North Bound) onto Wake Forest Road from Poplar Street. It is extremely dangerous; you have to pull out into Wake Forest Rd. in order to see if traffic is coming. This has been a problem for years and hope to see this fixed.
address: 1110 Wake Forest Road Raleigh, North Carolina

This email thread represents a situation in The Fields Development at 3404 Neptune Drive.  I, as the President of The Fields HOA Board of Directors, have worked with the City of Raleigh Inspections Office for more than a year to bring this issue to a resolution.  To the best of my knowledge, the homeowner has not pulled the appropriate permits for the construction of a retaining wall.  According to the below email string, the retaining wall is not acceptable to the City of Raleigh.  I understand that all folks in government have limits to their authority.  However, I’d like to know what action will be taken by the City of Raleigh to ensure that this retaining wall is correct in its design and construction.  Please advise.  Thank you.

Perry F. Stewart
President, The Fields HOA BOD
H/O 3209 Planet Drive
Raleigh NC 27604

I have no authority to do anything else.  For anything else to occur is outside the authority I am granted here at the City of Raleigh.  
Don Harris
City of Raleigh 
Building Inspector III
8320 Litchford Rd., Suite 130
PO Box 590
Raleigh, NC 27602-0590
Cell # (919) 278-6150
Email don.harris@raleighnc.gov
Website: www.raleighnc.gov

-----Original Message-----
From: Perry Stewart [mailto:pstewart5@nc.rr.com] 
Sent: Monday, August 04, 2014 5:21 PM
To: Harris, Don
Cc: Carlson, Robby
Subject: RE: No Permit Pulled - 3404 Neptune Drive
Mr. Harris,
Any change in status on this matter?  What is the next step for the City of Raleigh?  This excavation and retaining wall project has dragged on for the past year.  Please advise.  Thanks.

Perry F. Stewart
3209 Planet Drive
Raleigh NC 27604

-----Original Message-----
From: Harris, Don [mailto:Don.Harris@raleighnc.gov]
Sent: Tuesday, July 15, 2014 8:42 AM
To: Perry Stewart
Cc: Carlson, Robby
Subject: RE: No Permit Pulled - 3404 Neptune Drive
As per the email stream below my last piece of information was that the engineer the owner talked to said the as built condition does not work and the he would be taking it down and restructuring the wall and getting permits.  He has not obtained permits nor has any other work been done.

Don Harris

This past Tuesday, Aug 12th, the garbage truck that services my neighborhood left thick trails of oil on our streets. This wasn't a simple drip here and there, this was a steady stream of fluid. Surely the truck lost a substantial amount if oil; whether it be motor oil or hydraulic fluid. You can follow these oil trails throughout the Sawmill Rd area, tracing the truck's route. The stains are the heaviest in my immediate area [Hemlock Ct].

This is not only an eye sore, but also an environmental concern. There was rain Tuesday evening which in turn washed the standing oil into the surrounding drains. 

Myself and my neighbors hope that the department for truck maintenance is alerted of the leaking truck and it is repaired immediately. No doubt this truck is driving on other routes in Raleigh. Moreover, we would like our street treated in an environmentally safe way so that the oil is pulled up from the asphalt.

Thank you,

Neighbors of Hemlock Ct

I have almost been hit a few times, or must stand for awhile before cars will stop to let me walk.  In addition, there are many times that the cars do not even slow down once I am in the cross walk.  I use this crosswalk daily, and should not be fearful to use it to get to Greenway access.  I see teens trying to cross here to get to school as well.  Please add a sign at the very least, or make the cross walk more visible.  The bus stop makes it less likely for drivers to see pedestrians as well.

It is to the east of Swain St., one block away from the school.  This can't be ideal for student safety.  Additionally, there is a city bus stop on this block (E. Hargett between Swain and Monie).  The parked cars prevent the city bus from pulling up to the bus stop.  Finally, my neighbors and I have difficulty pulling out of our neighborhood (Monie Ln.), because we cannot see around the parked cars.  Today this block of Hargett St was only about half full of parked cars.  Many days the entire block is full of parked cars.  On those days, the buses can't get near the school. Most people do not seem to understand the mapping of the lanes when either going southbound on Lead Mine, or when turning left from North Hills onto Lead Mine. It is very common for drivers not to follow the lane lines, causing them to swerve within the intersection to get into whatever lane they think they need to be in, and creating a hazard for other drivers. There are signs for each lane, showing where the lanes will flow into Glenwood or the Beltline, but these do not seem to be sufficient. description: Driver on Outbound CAT bus 1285 (Northclift) did not stop for me at the stop. I raised my arms and screamed and ran after the bus and eventually she stopped. She had a passenger at the front carrying on a convo and distracting her. That's why I feel she didn't stop at the stop. After I sat down and she continued, the passenger continued to stand at the front and talk to her. I took a picture and then she got nasty with me, telling me it was illegal for me to do that. I just smiled and told her it wasn't. I even shared the bus had signs saying passengers were not allowed to carry on conversations with drivers. When I did, the passenger sat down. When I arrived at my destination, I got off the bus and just said Thank You as I usual do. Then the driver stopped me again very angry saying I was going I go to jail if I showed that picture because it was against the law. I told her to call dispatch or the police, I'd be happy to wait. She didn't. I also shared thy I would call and ask to meet with David Eatman about this. She has a problem with white people. She left me before. I have also been on her bus when she passed an old white man in a wheel chair. This is unacceptable. The fact that drivers are spending time carrying on conversations being distracted is also concerning, and not safe.  This was Cat bus 1285 outbound 8 at 7pm.
address: 100-136 Saint Marys Street Raleigh, NC 27605, USA

Last July the multi-purpose field at Williams Park was closed for renovation of the field to include the planting of Bermuda grass.  The field was to re-open in March of this year.  I was told last week that the Bermuda did not take and the field would remain closed most of this year as well.  I looked at the field this morning and the grass is very green which I find odd because Bermuda grass is still dormant.  There are a few areas that need additional attention, but overall I think the field is in good shape. 
A couple of years ago that field was closed using the excuse that there was a water drainage issue from the tennis courts.  Clearly there was no issue and the field was re-opened after I inquired to the Parks and Recreation Department.  Now we have this issue again with this field being closed and another phony excuse.  I use the word phony because clearly Bermuda grass was not planted.
Both of the closings of this field occurred immediately after groups of Hispanic people began playing soccer on the field.  About five to six years ago, the same thing happened at the Kiwanis Park.  The field was closed and a very large fence was erected and then locked.    The Hispanics that were playing at these fields were enjoying the weekend afternoons and from what I saw they were having a good time with their families and friends.  It is obvious to me these actions were the result of someone in the neighborhood complaining about the people using the field.  
The field at Williams Park belongs to the people of Raleigh and by keeping it closed your department is preventing all the citizens of Raleigh from enjoying the field.  The field needs to be re-opened immediately.
address: Lynn And Leadmine Raleigh, North Carolina

description: months have passed since a few neighbors reported the house  at 202 North State st. having lefft all of the trash and furniture in a moungtain on the yard near the street , it was there for a month and  another neighbor picked it p largely and hauled it away because he didn't want  the inspectors coming around.  This house has been the open flop for many people and the police are there almost every morning before dawn and many more times at night.   The Back windows and door are open  and are broken to  maintain access, the electricity had been hi jacked until last week when the power company took  the meter off again..  The squatters are not just homeless poor souls but some of the felons that have claimed this neighborhood  and are doing their selling  consistently here .  The police  can do nothing  to shut the house down and the inspectors case being removed is insane.  There has not been one day that that house has been secured ,  it was just sold in a "short sale" and  so that means  the owner hasn't closed but the bank or WHOEVER owns it needs to BOARD IT UP! This is sickening  that no one  can  keep the neighborhood from going to pot , There should be some mechanism for  stopping the people who put the city in decline  while not penalizing the people who are working hard to make  this place better.  Seriously  frustrated and disappointed in Raleigh   offices and personel who get paid  and make it hard on residents to appreciate the services. Once again , my question is what is it going to take for this neighborhood so close to the downtown to be cared for and managed better?  This area has a ridiculous amount of crime happening every day, I shouldn't have to remind anyone while a trial for a home invasion  is going on. We don't need more guns, we need more responsible care.  People need shelter  yes,but squatting  in a house illegally is not OK .
address: 202 North State St Raleigh, North Carolina

Glascock is clearly the main thoroughfare through this part of the neighborhood, yet for some reason those traveling on Culpepper don't have stop signs and those traveling on Glascock due. While I'm sure the original thought was to slow traffic on Glascock, I think there are other, safer ways to do so.

When making a LEFT turn onto  Capital Blvd  from Old Buffaloe Rd ,heading towards I-440. You have two LEFT turn Lanes. The road lines are painted, such that the  FAR LEFT lane must stay in that lane when they executes it turn onto CApital Blvd. and it new lane of travel is the FAR LEFT lane. The 2nd Left turn lane (2nd from LEFT on Old Buffaloe Rd. execute their LEFT turn into the 2nd lane to the LEFT on Capital Blvd. with the ability to take the 3rd/4th lanes. The PROBLEM is the Far LEFT turn lane drivers do not always stay in their most LEFT side lane but drift into the 2nd lane  because they expect the 2nd left lane drivers to take the 3rd/4th lanes on Capital Blvd leading to a fender bender or more severe accident. Recommend  re-marking lanes "STAY IN LANE" or repaint dashed white lane lines such that  the far LEFT lane gets the farthest /2nd Farthest lane on the LEFT on Capital Blvd. The 2nd LEFT turn lane on Old Buffaloe Rd. gets the 3rd and 4th lanes on Capital Blvd.
address: 3203-3219 Old Buffaloe Road Raleigh, North Carolina

summary: CAT BUS 8 NORTHCLIFT TOOK ANOTHER ROUTE
description:
Cat Bus 8 that departed Moore Square late (after 12 noon) did not take the route indicated by the raleighnc.gov website:

Posted on the COR site regarding Route 8:
O/B – From Hargett St., RIGHT on Wilmington St., LEFT on Edenton St., LEFT on Salisbury St., RIGHT on Hargett St., resume route. (See Krispy Kreme detours)

The Outbound 8 leaving after noon did NOT follow this route.  The Krispy Kreme detour ended at 12 noon.  Instead this bus went up Capital Blvd.  The INBOUND 8 bus driver followed the correct route.  I am left stranded because of yet another day of detoured bus routes where your drivers, managers, citizens, everybody is too confused to know exactly what is supposed to be going on.  I called the gotriangle hotline, and the phone operator had no clue whatsoever. You need to have a COMMUNICATIONS SPECIALIST WHO IS DETAIL ORIENTED WHICH MEANS THEY ARE SPECIFIC FOR EACH ROUTE instead of see this, follow that, etc which leaves things up to interpretation.  If you have someone in place who is supposed to do this then they are failing to do their job properly.  

YET ANOTHER POOR EXAMPLE OF HORRID CAT SERVICE IN THIS CITY.  All these complaints across the board of problems, and bus drivers not picking up handicapped passengers, there should be new leadership.

Just revisiting an issue that was closed by the city of Raleigh last month, before the problem was solved.  The last word from the city is that the project should have wrapped up on January 17th, 2014, then they closed the issue.  It's now Feb 6th, and we've seen no progress or updates from the city on the project.  

Can someone please let us know an accurate time table for when we'll have pavement again?  We're approaching 8 months on this project and the city has done very little to help move progress forward for us.

Living on a muddy pothole and gravel ridden street  is not only inconvenient and embarrassing but also damaging to all our vehicles, and messy in each of our yards.  I'm sure everyone would be very excited to hear from the city when the paving would likely begin and finish.

Thank you for a prompt update

summary: CAT bus driver not asking everyone for ID and inspecting others
description: This has bothered me all weekend so I decided to report this.  On Friday, the CAT bus driver let other passengers board from NC State by only swiping their GoPass.  I had my ID out and when I swiped and walked back to sit down the driver got rude, "You need to come back up here."  She wanted to see my ID and then she proceeds to tell me it don't look like me.  Well I have cancer and am going through treatment and that's why I don't have hair on my head like my ID shows.  If you're going to have a policy to make NC State employees show their ID you should be consistent, make all show their ID, not just those with a lighter tone of skin.

This isn't Ferguson, COR police. Stop harassing people on Fayetteville St. We are all having a good time and being peaceful. Stop harassing and threatening bar patrons on Fayetteville St!! If we need you, we will call you. It's unnecessary to have a militaristic attitude toward people trying to have fun on the weekend.  You should be welcoming people to downtown, not scaring them off.

I ride the JCX on a daily basis and would like to say I am increasingly disgruntled by the filthy sidewalks within Moore Square.  It is understandable that a bus terminal would be dirty, but filthy is another thing and its inexcusable. We have a beautiful city and this is a major discredit to us.  I understand renovations are coming within the next 12 months, but there is no excuse for the conditions there.  Soap and a power wash will do wonders.  PLEASE consider my request.

summary: CAT Bus Driver will not let NC State University Employees Ride bus without ID
description:
Please update your website if this is true.  The Raleigh CAT bus drivers (not all of them) are making NC State employees show their University ID.  Here's the problem. Not all temporary employees get an ID from the University and they were not being allowed to ride-  I looked on the City of Raleigh site, and there is no mention about showing an NC State University ID with your GOPASS.  I don't mind doing it, but there needs to be better communication.  There has been NONE from the University and the CoR site doesnt state that NC State employees must show their University ID when they swipe their GoPass.  

City of Raleigh (there is a $3 replacement fee for lost/stolen passes) and Wake County Government Employees
Free Rides with GoPass and ID Badge
North Carolina State University Students and Faculty/Staff (online purchases for faculty/staff include a $25 pre-paid fee)
Free Rides with GoPass (Order your pass online)
Meredith College Students, Faculty and Staff
Free Rides with ID Badge
Wake Tech
Free with ID Badge only on Wake Tech Express (40E)
address: 233 South Wilmington Street Raleigh, North Carolina

description: On Friday 1st August I was first on the scene at an accident which involved a driver losing vehicle control and crashing into cypress trees just beyond the intersection of Wild Dunes Drive and Royal Troon Drive in the Hedingham subdiivision. If the cyprees trees(planted by the property owner) had not been there the vehicle would have crashed into a house and caused serious damage to both house and vehicle not to mention possible loss of life. Wild Dunes Drive is used by drivers as a shortcut to using Southall to Eagle Trace. There have been several incidents at this intersection since 'traffic calming' was instituted on Eagle Trace. The only way to slow traffic on Wild Dunes Drive is to place speed bumps at strategic locations, which will prevent speeding and reckless driving. Wild Dunes is popular for pedestrians and is not meant to be a 'thruway' There is no sidewalk and a blind corner which makes entry into Wild Dunes Drive from Long Point and Grand Cypress a risky process.
address: Wild Dunes Drive Raleigh, North Carolina

summary: Whitaker Mill Road In Even Worse Shape
description: Over a week and a half ago the top layer of asphalt was shaved off in preparation for resurfacing that was to take place in later June or early July.   This road is in terrible condition.  In addition to the potholes and general rough texture there are multiple manhole-type covers and other fixtures that have raised asphalt surrounding them that are not painted or marked and are very hard to see at night.  This seems dangerous for a motorcyle, moped, or cars with lower profile tires.  It is furstrating that, again, there seems to be poor coordination between the time the road was prepped for resurfacing and the actual resurfacing.  There just doesnt seem to be anyting being done to improve the road condition on a day to day basis.  The entire project on this road has been mishandled and the residents in the neighborhood along this road, who pay substantial property taxes, have been poorly served during the duration of this debacle.   The City Council should take notice.  Im posting this hoping someone can give us an update of what is holding up progress on the resurfacing.
address: 117 East Whitaker Mill Road Raleigh, North Carolina

Running red lights is ridiculously rampant.  It happens every day at every light.  I am requesting that enforcement be made more of a priority.  Specifically, I would request that an UNMARKED police vehicle be posted at the Millbrook x Glenwood intersection.  There are 3 left turn lanes and multiple vehicles blow through the red long after it turns red daily, especially at rush hour.

I reported this before and a marked police vehicle was sent, so of course more people played by the rules.   Until the police car was gone.  

It's so bad that even for drivers on the other side of the street, you can to wait about 10 seconds after the light is green to start going (in the straight lane on Millbrook) because so many cars are just blatantly running the red and turning left on red anyway.  It is unsafe.

description: There has been a recent change to the traffic light pattern at Macon Pond Rd and Blue Ridge Rd.   This is not a good change during the morning commute.  What typically takes 7 minutes to get from Glenwood Ave to Lake Boone Trail using Duraleigh/Blue Ridge now takes 15 minutes.  The light isn't staying green long enough for the traffic coming on Duraleigh from Edwards Mill to make it through both the Blue Ridge and Macon Pond lights.  It's making traffic back up past Edwards Mill.   When it finally does turn green, the traffic coming from Blue Ridge at Crabtree all get to go through.   The traffic coming from Edwards Mill is stuck sitting at the Blue Ridge/Duraleigh light and then the Macon Pond light.   It's making traffic flow during the morning commute much more congested.

- the owner has parked a vehicle in the yard in violation of city code. 


Non-Erodible Surfaces Required for Residential Front-Yard Parking

The City of Raleigh requires that driveways and parking within the front yard of single family detached dwellings be constructed of non-erodible surfaces such as asphalt, concrete or pavers, or four inches of gravel with permanent borders.  Otherwise, parking is restricted to single-file parking in front of the driveway cut.

description: The intersection of Trailwood Dr and Lineberry has one of the most sensitive light changes.  While traveling on Trailwood, you're lucky to have the light stay green for more than 10 seconds.  If anyone at all is coming from Lineberry or towards Wolftech the light will begin to change before the car even reaches the intersection.  And if someone is simply turning right the light changes but the car has already turned and drove off.  More times than not the light just changes all of a sudden and no one is even there.  The intersection changes too frequently and might as well be a four way stop with how often it turns red.  Travel down the road a couple times of a day and its easy to see it.

summary: Last week's recycling not picked up
description: Called in Friday that my and my neighbor's recycling was missed.  No big deal.  Neighbor called again today, and he was told that they don't do pickups on Monday.  Again, no big deal.  Yet over lunch, somehow their recycling was retrieved.  Mine, 10 yards away, remains full.  Come on, guys?   I hate that you missed our houses.  Mistakes happen.  But when you come and empty my bin, please don't toss is haphazardly into the street like it's been hit by a car (because that's what happened to my neighbor today).  We respect you (neighbors put coolers of iced water bottles out in hot days!), so please return it to us.

Please take a look at this picture of 3304 Planet Drive, a long term vacant house in The Fields development that has become quite an eyesore.

Please note condition of house – to include vines growing up the front of the house along a window frame, facia board coverings peeled back exposing wood to the elements, and a hanging shutter.

Our HOA professional management company, HRW, Inc. has sent letters to BB&T about home maintenance.  This house is going downhill fast and needs to be addressed by the owners.  

This home is currently owned by BB&T.  The address on file for BB&T is 301 College St., Greenville, SC 29601-2014.  HRW has received no response from them to date regarding requests for corrective action.

As HOA Board President, I try and work toward maintaining and enhancing the value of homes in our development -- both for homeowners and for the community at large.  A rundown home such as this erodes homeowners' home values and contributes to eventual decline in the entire development.

Please weigh in on this matter with the enforcement capacity of the City of Raleigh to get this home cleaned up.

Thanks!

Perry Stewart

Most recently there has been a large amount of trash and items like old furniture, mattress and boxes in the front yard for several days.  

One example is in the photo attached.

Crossing Six Forks road going east at Lassiter Mill road, the traffic light will not turn green to go straight across if you are not there for a good bit of time.  This morning I arrived at the intersection a good 10 seconds before the light turned red for Six Forks and the light did not turn green for me to cross Six Forks.  There was traffic waiting to cross Six Forks from the other direction and the light turned green for that side, but not my side.  Logic dictates that if one side gets green to go straight, the other should get green as well.

summary: Broken Water Main Third week of not repaired, 10k gals wasted
description:
Two weeks ago there was a broken water main at this intersection (see map) They dug the street up, "fixed" it, and back filled the hole in, capping it with asphalt.
Last week I notice water streaming out from under the capped asphalt. I called the City public utility dept after hours to report this to which they said they would send someone out. Thats been 6 days and water is still flowing out of this repair, enough water the whole northbound lane is wet and water runs into the gutter and into the sewer system.
This is the third time I am reporting this albeit to a different department.
So being that this is the third time, what happens when my water bill comes? Obviously no one cares enough about a broke water main to fix it. Should I be so concerned about *MY* water bill to not pay it? The city can let thousands and thousands of gallons go to waste down the sewer and yet Im expected to pay for the same product? How is this even remotely fair?
address: 4200 Six Forks Rd Raleigh, North Carolina

I apologize for the picture being upside down.  When I uploaded it, it was right side up.  Once it was uploaded, I was unable to change the orientation.  This residence, 3332 Planet Drive, has become a nuisance property within The Fields Homeowners Association (HOA).  The general upkeep of the house has degraded over time (e.g. entire house in need of power washing, front porch railings, supports, and steps in need of power washing & treatment).  Please see recent picture attached.  Note the discarded mattress and the debris-filled trailer that have been there for weeks now. The owners have been mailed both a first and second violation letter from the HOA to power wash home, railings, supports, etc.  A hearing letter has been mailed regarding the inappropriately stored items in the yard.  While the The Fields HOA Board and HRW, our professional management company, are working to schedule a hearing for our next board meeting, we would appreciate the assistance of the City of Raleigh by investigating this property.  Our understanding is that the property is rented and occupied by tenants.  This home has been an ongoing problem for many years.  The owners and/or residents have received numerous violation letters for non-compliance such as parking on the lawn, maintenance of the home, mowing, junk in yard and/or around the house, unregistered and/or inoperable vehicles parked on the street and more.  Thank you for your assistance in getting this property cleaned up.

Perry F. Stewart
President, The Fields HOA Board
Raleigh NC 27604

summary: Clogged stream hosts Mosquito Fest, looks unkempt
description:
The stream that runs through the Marshall Street green area is clogged in several places due to vegetation overgrowth, trimmed vegetation that has fallen into the stream and runoff from driveways on Marshall St. These areas of stagnant water are home to more mosquitos than our neighborhood can stand, and the overgrowth is becoming more jungle-like each year. The poison ivy has taken up residence everywhere you look. 

Please, DEHNR and Parks and Rec give us a hand. I realize the two of you are at odds on how to handle this stream but we're working on a health hazard here.

Three 18 wheelers parked overnight (5/17/14-5/18/14) on Pine Knoll Drive between Old Buffalo and the end of the road. This incident was reported to RPD at 10:07 AM. At 6pm the dispatch had no record of an officer issuing a warning, citation, or ticket to any of the offenders. At 6pm, one of the vehicles had exited the area, but two remain and an additional 18 wheeler has joined them. 

Parked trucks limit visibility and maneuverability for traffic entering and exiting the Cici's pizza lot. Is is too much to ask that the Police enforce the city code?

According to Sec. 11-2176. TRUCK PARKING
All motor truck carriers operating as either common or contract carriers over regular or irregular routes, all passenger bus carriers, and all other owners of motor trucks or trailers of any kind, including house trailers, whose trucks, truck-trailers, trailers, semi-trailers, house trailers or buses at any time are operated into, out of, through, or within the corporate limits of the City and the drivers and operators of any such vehicles shall use PRIVATE PROPERTY FOR PARKING AND STORING THOSE VEHICLES within the corporate limits, and they are hereby PROHIBITED FROM USING THE PUBLIC STREETS OF THE CITY except for the purposes of travel and transporting, loading and unloading passengers and except for temporary parking in cases of emergency involving a mechanical breakdown necessitating repairs to any such vehicle. Provided that the provisions of this section shall not apply to mass transit buses owned by the City, trucks of three-fourths-ton capacity or less, nor shall it apply to school buses parked in conformity with permits issued by the Police Department.
(Code 1959 , §21-36; Ord. No. 1977-420, §1, 1-4-77)
address: Pine Knoll Drive Raleigh, North Carolina

description: Light in front of 5028 Wickham is out.  Thank you

Unsafe, vacant property. This property has been in this condition for 4+ years. It's partially constructed and falling apart with Columns bowing under weight of the house. It's dangerous and with such a long history if vacancy, it attracts foot traffic, drug usage, litter and loitering. It's been diminishing the value of surrounding properties and neighborhood quality of life for years. It's unsafe and a terrible eyesore in what is trying to become a thriving, safe downtown neighborhood.  The property would be better as an empty lot and after 4 years, the structure is clearly not being completed. It would never pass a structural inspection at this point. 

Please, please, for the sake of Raleigh's growing reputation and the people who actually call this neighborhood home, please do something about this property!

Vehicles are going pretty fast as they approach this intersection, which makes the lack of advanced notice even more dangerous since cars in the left lane must quickly merge right to stay on the road or be forced into an unwanted left turn. A mounted sign announcing that the left lane will become turn-only would make this a safer intersection. Thanks in advance for looking at this.

summary: Neighbor Cutting down all the trees ruining value of my property
description: How is it that it is ok to cut all the trees down on the lot lines in this neighborhood that has already lost so many to the tornado?  My back neighbor cut a 150 foot Magnolia yesterday, and today the  cutter says he's going to clear all the others left. 2 tall deciduous trees.  Now we are exposed to both his full house and the other neighbors parking lot and sheds, and the vale of our property has plummeted!  NO SHADE NO PROTECTION from a view of their ugly space.  There's no way in the world to plant anything  to take the place of an OLD VALUABLE, ESTABLISHED TREE , they have a huge impact on the neighborhood aesthetic and  worth as well as the environment.  I talked to a COR person in zoning and he said there was only a ruling for percentage of allowable cutting for properties over 2 acres. It should be the other way around!   Can't the COR get this right?  Stop letting people run roughshod over each other! That includes developers.

Trash including,bottles,cans,wrappers,food,yard waste etc found all along the edge of this club ends up in the water. My neighborhood is located on the other side of this pond and we see trash floating every day in the water that comes from this nightclub.This is the same nightclub that has been reported to the RPD and taken to court for numerous noise ordinance violations. This dangerous intersection has been reported here at least twice in the past. Now major construction has begun on a piece of land that adjoins the intersection. Trucks are parked on the street, reducing visibility even further. 

But more importantly: When the condo construction is completed, will the driveway for the new residences empty onto Ashland Street in the exact location where we already have the serious issues with visibility, driver speed, etc. that have previously been discussed here? If so, and no new signs, flashing lights etc. are added, the intersection will become even more dangerous. 

Can someone in the appropriate city department please check the construction plan (and more specifically the entrance/exit/parking plan) for the new residences, and see if we are indeed going to be dumping more traffic onto this already-hazardous section of road? And if so, can someone please develop a plan to help reduce the likelihood of an accident? Thanks in advance for checking into this.

description: Hello, every afternoon I take graham newton home from work. At the tenten intersection, there is always a huge line of cars. The result is that it usually takes multiple light cycles to get through the intersection, and traffic is often backed up several blocks. There is plenty of room to add a left turn lane here, and this would help improve flow tremendously.

Seems the parklink folks are back at it again. overagressive behavior, stalking vehicles, quick to attack.
these folks are NOT friendly to talk to, or to even ask a question. The ladies that work in the office are even more disrepectful, rude and mean to people. somehow I guess they feel they are entitled to be jerks. 
(there is one guy, black heavy set, and has dreadlocks..who has expressed overagressive behavior to people when asked a question..I witnessed it on west st last friday. hes been seen driving a white chevy pickup or a white dodge 4dr. )

this kind of behavior, from so called "city employees" give Raleigh iteslf a bad name, and keeps folks from visiting the downtown area. Im sure this is NOT what the city wants as downtown ambassadors.

these are the same concerns we as citizens have had when the parking enforcement dept was under private contract. but by just simply transfering the dept back to the city, did no good. the city needed to replace the staff at park link then, as that was the problem then, and continues to be today.

there should be NO excuse for these employees to act like they do. I understand they deal with frustrated people, and folks yelling at them, but when someone just says "hey, can you point me to (direction)" their response shouldnt be like we are bothering them. this is unprofessional, and disrespectful, especially to tax payers who pay their hourly wages.

thank you for your concern.

description:
I was biking on the greenway with a group yesterday coming inbound to downtown Raleigh from the Neuse River Trail on the Walnut Creek Greenway.  The tunnels on that section are all poorly lit. There are at least 10 sections of the Walnut Creek Greenway between the new connector and State Street that are becoming increasingly filled with slippery mud from the rain storms.  All of these sections were challenging to navigate by bike and you would not be able to go through this area with a family or children due to all of the maintenance issues.  On foot someone would have been forced to walk through large sections of mud.  The underpass/tunnel at State Street is impassible by bicycle or on foot due to all of the mud and slippery growth.  One of our cyclists wiped in the tunnel. I know it says to dismount, but when the choice is wading through an indeterminate amount of mud or attempting the crossing on the bicycle, most people will choose to ride and stay above the muck.  We decided to abandon the Walnut Creek Greenway at State Street and used roads on the eastside of Raleigh to get back into downtown.  Please start doing maintenance on the Walnut Creek Greenway.  

Compared with the quality of the Neuse River Greenway, and as much as we tout our greenway system in Raleigh as an amenity, it's an embarrassment.
address: Walnut Creek Trail Raleigh, North Carolina

In the 2nd townhouse from the left lives a man and a woman who used to leave their dog outside all night in the rain, cold, and snow.  Then my roommate called animal control.  It stopped for a few weeks.  Then I called animal control again when it was left without shelter or water in icy conditions, and it stopped a few days.  Then another neighbor called for them beating the dog. Nothing changed.  It is now 3:30 AM and all I hear and see is the man kicking the dog repeatedly and the dog yelping.  I woke up at 2:50 to him yelling at the dog.  These neighbors are no good.  Up all night having parties and doing drugs with their friends....then beating the crap out of their dog when their friends leave.  He has kicked the dog 17 times tonight that I have witnessed.  Noise ordinance violation? Animal Cruelty? Drug Abuse?  This place has em all!

It is 2:30 am and the driving bass at CAPITAL VIP / CLYMAXX is still going strong. My neighbors (Mordecai and Oakwood) and I have made numerous calls to Raleigh PD tonight to no avail. This is a regular occurrence on Thursday through Saturday nights and something needs to change. 

What do we need to do to get this nuisance club dealt with?

summary: rocks on Raleigh Blvd from Greenway "construction"
description:
The crews working inside the greenway dropped a ton of rocks all over Raleigh Blvd that are flying up and hitting cars.  Please have them remove all the debris to prevent further damage to vehicles. 

While we're on it, please also address  why 6 months worth of work in the Greenway stretching into years?  Is anyone checking to see why there doesn't seem to be any progress and the park continues to be torn up while equipment and vehicles are in the same spots not doing anything?

As you approach the Gorman/Faircloth and Hillsborough St. intersection from Gorman street, the left turn traffic signal has a very long wait time. Specific example: this morning, I approached it as the only vehicle in that lane and sat through 4 (4!) light changes before it let me turn. And I don't mean 2 in either direction- I mean traffic crossing the intersection going both ways got 3 green lights EACH before I was able to turn left on the 4th green light for Gorman.

That being said, I do give the light credit in that the light changes are pretty quick. The issue seems to arise in that if only one vehicle approaches the left turn, it is not enough to trigger the left turn signal- even if you approach it in a wide variety of fashions (slow, fast, pull up to the white, don't pull up all the way, etc), and I drive a pickup truck so it's a heavy vehicle (that counts, right? :) ) Only when another car approaches behind the first will the light finally trigger, but that can take a while at 6:50am.

I understand that it's not a particularly pressing concern but the alternatives are to put your car in reverse and then pull forward again, or to cut through behind the applebee's parking lot and skip the light entirely, or just RUN IT (yikes!) as I have seen cars do in the morning... all of which seem to be unsafe/not particularly legal. I pass through this light 5 days a week at ~6:55 or ~7:25 and I have tried everything to trigger that light and it is pretty futile unless there are multiple cars trying to turn too. If that's just the way it is, I understand. But if it can be verified that there is not a malfunction with the triggering system or something, that would be great.
address: Gorman/Faircloth And Hillsborough Street Intersection Raleigh, NC
